common.confirm-action-description: Are you sure you want to perform this action? This action cannot be undone.

feature.save-anyway-description:
Are you sure you want to save invalid Xray config? This action
                                    can lead to unexpected behavior. Continue only if you know what
                                    you are doing.

feature.table-controler-description-line-1: This table provides several controls to help you view and manage the data effectively. Here's what each control does:
feature.table-controler-description-line-4: Toggle column filters to search and filter data

feature.force-restart-description: will guarantee that all nodes will fully restart Xray Core.
feature.graceful-restart-description-1: will send a request to all nodes to restart Xray, but request can be unfulfilled if the node hash is the same as the current one. This is the default option.

widget.your-changes-will-be-lost-if-you-leave-t: Your changes will be lost if you leave this page without saving.

widget.please-select-the-config-profile-and-inb: Please select the config profile and inbound

widget.allowing-insecure-connections-can-lead-t: Allowing insecure connections can lead to security risks. We do not recommend enabling this option.

widget.header-description-line-1: A host is an entry point for a user. A group of hosts forms a so-called "subscription".
widget.header-description-line-2: Each host can optionally refer to one server.
widget.remark-description-line-1: The name of the host. It can be anything but must remain unique within a single subscription.
widget.remark-description-line-2: The remark will be displayed in the list of available servers in the end client.
widget.inbound-line-1: It is necessary to select an inbound to which a host will be bound.
widget.inbound-line-2: The list of inbounds is derived from the "Xray Config".
widget.address-and-port-line-1: In most cases the IP/domain name should point to one of the connected nodes.
widget.address-and-port-line-2: The port must be open and accessible for incoming connections.
widget.address-and-port-line-3: Usually the port should match the inbound port from the Xray configuration.
widget.advanced-settings: "Advanced Settings" are additional parameters that can be used to further customize the host.
widget.advanced-settings-2: Anything specified in "Advanced Settings" will take a higher priority than what is specified in the Xray configuration.

widget.remark-description: This is the name of the host that will be displayed in the dashboard.

widget.only-active-nodes: Only nodes with active traffic tracking are displayed
widget.nodes-with-active-traffic-tracking-not-f: Nodes with active traffic tracking not found.

widget.traffic-reset-strategy-description: How often the user's traffic usage statistics should be reset
widget.data-limit-description: Enter data limit in GB (0 for unlimited)
widget.telegram-id-of-a-user-in-telegram: Numeric ID of the user in Telegram messenger
widget.hwid-user-limit-line-1: This feature will only work if
widget.expire-at-description: The date and time when the user's subscription will expire.
widget.internal-squads-description: Specify which internal squads the user will be a member of.

widget.subscription-url-description-line-1: Domain and path resolved from .env variable:
widget.subscription-url-description-line-2: If you want to change it, please change it in the .env file and restart Remnawave using command:

base-host-form.here-you-can-override-security-settings-: Here you can override security settings from XTLS Config.
base-host-form.extra-xhttp-description: This setting will only work with the XHTTP protocol. An "extra" object JSON will be passed to the client. The JSON input is not validated, be sure to enter a valid configuration. You can use the button below to copy the basic extra settings and paste it into the JSON input.
base-host-form.fill-with-sample-xhttp-extra-params: Fill with sample XHTTP extra options
base-host-form.address-description-line-1: Address must be the IP address or a domain name pointing to the connection destination.
base-host-form.address-description-line-2: In most cases, it should points to the one of connected nodes.
base-host-form.port-description-line-2: In most cases, must match the port of selected inbound.
base-host-form.sni-description-line-1: SNI stands for Server Name Indication.
base-host-form.sni-description-line-2: If not specified, the value from config's inbound will be used.
base-host-form.select-one-inbound-to-apply-to-the-host: Select an inbound to apply to the host
base-host-form.server-description-line-1: This feature works only with Happ with the ProviderID value. Please, refer to
base-host-form.server-description-line-4: Remnawave will encode this value to base64. Do not place encoded value here.
base-host-form.this-will-only-be-used-for-xray-json-out: This will only be used for Xray-JSON output.
base-host-form.please-ensure-you-provide-a-valid-json-m: Please ensure you provide a valid JSON MUX object.
base-host-form.please-ensure-you-provide-a-valid-json-s: Please ensure you provide a valid JSON Sockopt object.
base-host-form.hide-host-from-users-remnawave-will-send: Hide host from users, Remnawave will send host only for RAW Subscription responses.
base-host-form.multi-domain-description: Multiple domains separated by commas. Remnawave will randomly choose one of the domains.
base-host-form.wildcard-domain-description: Wildcard pattern for subdomains. Remnawave will replace * with the randomly generated string.
base-host-form.override-sni-from-address-description: This option replaces the SNI value with the specified Address field value. This is particularly useful for multi-domain configurations or wildcard domains configuration.
base-host-form.shuffled-hosts-hover-card: Shuffled hosts will be placed at the top of the list and sorted randomly.
base-host-form.pick-nodes-which-resolved-from-this-host: Pick nodes which resolved from this host. Only visual assignment.

base-node-form.consumption-m-line-1: Applies selected multiplier to user's traffic (1.0 = normal, 0.5 = half, 2.0 = double).
base-node-form.consumption-m-line-2: In simple terms, this means that if a user's traffic limit is 1 GiB and the consumption multiplier is 2.0, the user will be able to use only 0.5 GiB of traffic (real usage), but Remnawave will show usage as 1 GiB and the user will be LIMITED.

component.no-data-available-for-the-selected-perio: No data available for the selected period
component.click-to-highlight-only-this-node: Click to highlight only this node

widget.user-deletion-description: Delete all users with selected status. If you will delete users with "Active" status, you should restart all nodes to apply changes.

feature.password-copied-error: Failed to copy password to clipboard
feature.register-description: Create a super-admin account to get started

widget.description-line-1: To use this subscription, just add
widget.description-line-2: at the end of your subscription link. Make sure you're using one of the supported apps listed in the table below. Otherwise, subscription will work as usual for requested client. (e.g. Base64, Mihomo)

widget.enter-the-configuration-name: Enter a name for the configuration
widget.name: Name
widget.proxy-all-traffic-except-rules: Proxy all traffic except the rules
widget.direct-all-traffic-except-rules: Direct route all traffic except the rules
widget.proxy-all-traffic-except-rules-or-direct: Proxy all traffic except the rules, or direct route all traffic except the rules
widget.fake-dns-description: Enable or disable FakeDNS. Recommended to activate when using DoU.
widget.choose-doh-dns-over-https-or-dou-dns-ove: Whether to use DoH (DNS over HTTPS) or DoU (DNS over UDP) for the remote DNS
widget.domain-name-for-doh: Domain name for the DNS server (if DoH)
widget.server-ip-for-doh-or-dou: DNS Server IP address for DoH or DoU
widget.domestic-dns-type-description: Whether to use DoH (DNS over HTTPS) or DoU (DNS over UDP) for the domestic DNS
widget.server-ip-for-doh-or-dou-0: DNS Server IP address for DoH or DoU
widget.geoip-description: Link to the geoip.dat file. Leave this field empty if you want to use the default file.
widget.geosite-description: Link to the geosite.dat file. Leave this field empty if you want to use the default file.
widget.unix-timestamp-description: Enter the Unix timestamp of the last update to the geoip and geosite files. Leave empty if not available.
widget.dns-hosts-description: Enter the DNS hosts in this format: { "example.com": "1.2.3.4", "test.org": "8.8.8.8" }
widget.sites-that-will-use-direct-connection: Domain names that shouldn't be proxied and use a direct connection.
widget.ip-addresses-that-will-use-direct-connec: IP addresses that shouldn't be proxied and use a direct connection.
widget.sites-that-will-be-proxied: Domain names that should be proxied.
widget.ip-addresses-that-will-be-proxied: IP addresses that should be proxied.
widget.sites-that-will-be-blocked: Domain names that should be blocked.
widget.ip-addresses-that-will-be-blocked: IP addresses that should be blocked.
widget.paste-a-happ-routing-link-or-base64-enco: Paste a Happ routing link or Base64 encoded config
widget.paste-base64-or-happ-link-here: Paste Base64 or Happ Link here

component.happ-is-multiplatform-xray-client: Happ is a multiplatform Xray client.
component.about-happ-description-line-2: Here you can configure routing rules, which you can then encode and use as a Happ Link.
component.about-happ-description-line-3: To use a given Happ routing configuration in your subscription links, open "Subscription settings" and change the "Happ Routing" section.

widget.you-must-add-at-least-one-remark-with-te: You must add at least one remark with text
widget.this-title-will-be-displayed-as-subscrip: This title will be displayed as the subscription name.
widget.auto-update-description: Some client applications follow this interval to auto-update the subscription.
widget.support-link-description: Some clients will display this link in the subscription information. The link should lead the user to the support page.
widget.happ-announce-description: 200 characters maximum. Will be displayed under the subscription name in Happ.
widget.happ-routing-description: Happ routing is a feature that allows you to configure the routing rules that Xray-Core will use through the subscription link.
widget.happ-routing-description-line-2: A routing link for Happ can be obtained through Remnawave's Happ Routing Builder. The button below will redirect you to the aforementioned page.
widget.user-status-remarks-description: The following values will be displayed in the subscription page if the user is expired, limited or disabled.
widget.user-status-remarks-description-line-2: You can add multiple remarks for each status.
widget.user-status-remarks-description-line-3: Because expired, limited and disabled users are not able to connect to the server, they will see these remarks in the client instead of receiving an empty subscription.
widget.profile-webpage-url-description: Used by some clients. Enabled by default, domain obtained from SUB_PUBLIC_DOMAIN .env variable.
widget.serve-json-description: Serve JSON configurations at the base subscription path (without having to append /json). If the client supports it, it will be served JSON, otherwise it will be served as usual.
widget.add-username-description: Append #username to the base subscription path at the subscription route.
widget.subscription-info-description: Subscription links are supported by many client apps such as Happ, v2RayNG, Streisand, etc.
widget.happ-description-line-1: Here you can configure settings specific to Happ.
widget.happ-description-line-2: These settings will only apply to subscription links that are imported in Happ.

component.subscription-settings-description: The settings below apply to subscription link details used and displayed by client apps such as Happ, v2RayNG, Streisand, etc.
component.subscription-settings-description-line-2: It is recommended to change the values to match your specific needs and circumstances.

feature.are-you-sure-you-want-to-delete-these-ho: Are you sure you want to delete these hosts?

feature.reset-traffic-description: Resets the traffic usage to zero for all selected users

feature.danger-zone-description: These actions are irreversible and can result in permanent data loss.
feature.delete-users-by-status-description: Permanently deletes all users with the selected status

feature.resets-the-traffic-usage-to-zero-for-all: Resets the traffic usage to zero for all selected users
feature.revokes-subscription-for-all-selected-us: Revokes subscription for all selected users
feature.specify-internal-squads-that-will-be-ass: Specify internal squads that will be assigned to the user
feature.changes-the-active-internal-squads-for-a: Changes the active internal squads for all selected users

feature.these-actions-are-irreversible-and-can-r: These actions are irreversible and can result in permanent data loss.
feature.permanently-deletes-all-selected-users-a: Permanently deletes all selected users and their data

feature.are-you-sure: Are you sure you want to delete the user? This action is irreversible.

widget.snippets-help-line-1: They are used to predefine some of your configurations.
widget.snippets-help-line-2: A snippet must contain an array of Outbound or Rule objects, and at least one item is required.
widget.snippets-help-line-3: Autocomplete is available for snippet names. Also, you can quickly preview the snippet by hovering over the name in the editor.
widget.snippets-help-line-4: Inside outbounds[], you can reference the snippets by name.
widget.snippets-help-line-5: Inside routing.rules[], you can reference the snippets by name.

widget.subscription-templates-description-line-: Select one template for each subscription type. If not selected, the default template will be used automatically.
Please note, Response Rules have a higher priority.
